com.jaunt
Class Document

java.lang.Object
  com.jaunt.Node
      com.jaunt.Element
          com.jaunt.Document

public class Document
extends Element

Represents an HTML, XHTML, or XML Document

Since:
0.9.0
Author:
Tom Cervenka

getHyperlink

public Hyperlink getHyperlink(java.lang.String linkRegex)
                       throws NotFound
Returns the hyperlink who's corresponding anchor element has innerText matching the specified (case insensitive) regular expression (using Matcher.matches).

Throws:
NotFound

getTable

public Table getTable(java.lang.String elementQuery)
               throws NotFound
Returns a Table component for the first table Element that matches the specified elementQuery (or throws a NotFound Exception). The elementQuery has the general form
<tagnameRegex attributeName="attributeValueRegex">
where multiple attributes are allowed. In order for the query to match against an element, the tagnameRegex, attribute name, attributeValueRegex and immediateTextRegex must match if they are specified.
tagnameRegex: If tagnameRegex is a whitespace character, it will match any tagname. Otherwise, the tagnameRegex will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against entire tagnames (ie will not match substrings). The tagnameRegex must begin with either an alphabetical character or a round opening bracket, and may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace)
attributeName: If no attributes are included in the query, the query will match any attributes in a candidate element (including one without attributes). Otherwise, the attributeName in the query is matched as a case-insensitive string, not as a regular expression.
attributeValueRegex: If attributeValueRegex is not present, the attributeName in the query will be matched against candidate attributeNames irrespective of their attributeValues. If attributeValueRegex is present, it will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against the entire corresponding attribute value (ie will not match substrings)..
immediateTextRegex: If immediateTextRegex is not present, the query will match any immediate child text (including lack of text). Otherwise, immediateTextRegex will be evaluated against the concatenation of immediate Text children of the Element. It's important to note that the immediateTextRegex is case sensitive and will match substrings. The immediateTextRegex, if unquoted, may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace).

Throws:
NotFound

getTable

public Table getTable(Element tableElement)
               throws NotFound
Returns a Table component for the specified table Element or throws a NotFound exception if the specified element is not a table.

Throws:
NotFound

getTable

public Table getTable(int n)
               throws NotFound
Returns a Table component representing the nth non-nested table Element in the document, or throws a NotFound exception if no table element is found.

Throws:
NotFound

getFormByButtons

public Form getFormByButtons(java.lang.String[] buttonLabelRegexs)
                      throws NotFound
Returns a Form object for the first form Element containing buttons who's text/values are matched (case insensitive) by the regular expressions in the specified array (using Matcher.matches()), or throws a NotFound Exception.

Parameters:
buttonLabelRegexs - can be null to force a button match, otherwise contains the regular expressions for matching (in a case insensitive manner) button text/values.
Throws:
NotFound

getFormByButton

public Form getFormByButton(java.lang.String buttonLabelRegex)
                     throws NotFound
Returns a Form object for the first form Element containing a button who's text/values is matched (case insensitive) by the specified regular expression (using Matcher.matches()), or throws a NotFound Exception.

Parameters:
buttonLabelRegex - can be null to force a button match, otherwise contains the regular expressions for matching (in a case insensitive manner) button text/values.
Throws:
NotFound

getFormByName

public Form getFormByName(java.lang.String nameRegex)
                   throws NotFound
Returns a Form object for the first form Element that has the specified name (ie, value of the name attribute) or throws a NotFound Exception.

Parameters:
nameRegex - can be null to force a name match, otherwise contains the regular expressions for matching (in a case insensitive manner) the value of the name attribute in form Elements.
Throws:
NotFound

getForm

public Form getForm(java.lang.String elementQuery)
             throws NotFound
Returns a Form object for the first form Element that matches the specified elementQuery (or throws a NotFound Exception). The elementQuery has the general form
<tagnameRegex attributeName="attributeValueRegex">
where multiple attributes are allowed. In order for the query to match against an element, the tagnameRegex, attribute name, attributeValueRegex and immediateTextRegex must match if they are specified.
tagnameRegex: If tagnameRegex is a whitespace character, it will match any tagname. Otherwise, the tagnameRegex will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against entire tagnames (ie will not match substrings). The tagnameRegex must begin with either an alphabetical character or a round opening bracket, and may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace)
attributeName: If no attributes are included in the query, the query will match any attributes in a candidate element (including one without attributes). Otherwise, the attributeName in the query is matched as a case-insensitive string, not as a regular expression.
attributeValueRegex: If attributeValueRegex is not present, the attributeName in the query will be matched against candidate attributeNames irrespective of their attributeValues. If attributeValueRegex is present, it will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against the entire corresponding attribute value (ie will not match substrings)..
immediateTextRegex: If immediateTextRegex is not present, the query will match any immediate child text (including lack of text). Otherwise, immediateTextRegex will be evaluated against the concatenation of immediate Text children of the Element. It's important to note that the immediateTextRegex is case sensitive and will match substrings. The immediateTextRegex, if unquoted, may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace).

Throws:
NotFound

             throws NotFound
Returns the Form for the specified form Element or throws a NotFound Exception.

Throws:
NotFound

followMetaRedirect

public boolean followMetaRedirect(int redirectCount)
                           throws ResponseException
Follows the first redirecting meta tag (unless it occurs in a noScript section and the executeNoscript UserAgentSetting is false).

Parameters:
redirectCount - the number of automatic, sequential redirects that occured prior to this redirection.
Returns:
true if a meta tag was followed.
Throws:
ResponseException

getHeaders

public MultiMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getHeaders(java.lang.String key)
Returns a MultiMap containing the headers received for this document, where each header name is associated with one or more header values.

headersToString

public java.lang.String headersToString()
Returns a string representation of the headers.

public Form getActiveForm()
Returns the Form that is currently active.

fillout

public Document fillout(java.lang.String label,
                        java.lang.String value)
                 throws NotFound,
                        MultipleFound
Fills the textfield, password field, or textarea field that has the specified text label with the specified value.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive, left-side label.
Returns:
a reference to the document.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

select

public Document select(java.lang.String label,
                       java.lang.String optionRegex)
                throws NotFound,
                       MultipleFound
Completes the dropdown menu or menu list (ie select component) that has the specified text label (case insensitive, space insensitive) with the option(s) that matches (using Matcher.matches) the specified (case insensitive) regular expression.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive, left-side label.
optionRegex - case-insensitive regular expresion to match the text of one or more options.
Returns:
a reference to the document
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

choose

public Document choose(short labelOrientation,
                       java.lang.String labelRegex)
                throws NotFound,
                       MultipleFound
Selects the radiobutton or checkbox who's label is matched by the specified (case-insensitive) regular expression.

Parameters:
labelRegex - case-insensitive regular expression matching the label of the radiobutton or checkbox.
labelOrientation - orientation constant of class Text indicating the position of the label with respect to the radiobutton or checkbox.
Returns:
a reference to the document.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

unchoose

public Document unchoose(short labelOrientation,
                         java.lang.String labelRegex)
                  throws NotFound,
                         MultipleFound
Deselects the radiobutton or checkbox who's label is matched by the specified (case-insensitive) regular expression.

Parameters:
labelRegex - case-insensitive regular expression matching the label of the radiobutton or checkbox.
labelOrientation - Text orientation constant indicating the position of the label with respect to the radiobutton or checkbox.
Returns:
a reference to the document.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

submit

public Document submit()
                throws SearchException,
                       ResponseException
Submits the active form by pressing the submit button, throws a MultipleFound exception if more than one submit button exists.

Returns:
the Document created as a result of this submission.
Throws:
SearchException
ResponseException

submit

public Document submit(java.lang.String buttonLabelRegex)
                throws SearchException,
                       ResponseException
Submits the active form using the submit button who's text matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression, using Matcher.matches.

Parameters:
buttonLabelRegex - case-insensitive regular expression to match the value of the submit button's value attribute.
Returns:
the Document created as a result of this submission.
Throws:
SearchException
ResponseException
